Welcome to Imagine’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a function that checks the health of the database. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t, then we know something is wrong with our connection to the database.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with a message key and value

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶
async main.read_root(request: Request)¶

The greeting message.

REST API repository Photos¶

async src.repository.photos.add_tag_to_photo(photo_id: int, name_tag: str, db: AsyncSession)¶
The add_tag_to_photo function adds a tag to the photo with max numbers tags = 5.
Args:

photo_id (int): The id of the photo. name_tag (str): The name of the tag.

Returns:

dict: A dictionary with success message if everything went well, or an error message otherwise.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Specify the photo to which you want to add a tag

  • name_tag – str: Specify the name of the tag to be added

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary

async src.repository.photos.assembling_tags(source_tags: list[str], db: AsyncSession) → List[Tag]¶
async src.repository.photos.change_photo(user: User, photo_id: int, db: AsyncSession, width: int, height: int, crop_mode: str, effect: str) → Photo¶

The change_photo function takes a photo_id, width, height, crop_mode and effect as input. It then checks if the crop mode is allowed. If it is not allowed an error message will be returned to the user. If it is allowed then the transformation of the image will take place on cloudinary and a new url for that transformed image will be returned along with its QR code.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the username of the user

  • photo_id – int: Identify the photo in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • width – int: Set the width of the photo

  • height – int: Set the height of the photo

  • crop_mode – str: Specify the crop mode that will be used to transform the photo

  • effect – str: Apply a filter to the image

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: transformed_url and qr code

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.repository.photos.check_tags_quantity(tags: list[str]) → bool | None¶
async src.repository.photos.create_photo(photofile: File(PydanticUndefined), description: str | None, user: User, db: AsyncSession, list_tags: List[str])¶

The create_photo function save data of a new photo in cloud storage.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.photos.del_photo_tag(photo_id: int, name_tag: str, db: AsyncSession)¶
The del_photo_tag function deletes a tag from the photo.
Args:

photo_id (int): The id of the photo to delete a tag from. name_tag (str): The name of the tag to be deleted.

Returns:

dict: A dictionary containing success message if successful, or an error message otherwise.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Find the photo in the database

  • name_tag – str: Specify the name of the tag to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A dictionary

async src.repository.photos.delete_photo(photo_id: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession) → bool¶
The delete_photo function deletes a photo from the database and cloudinary.
Args:

photo_id (int): The id of the photo to be deleted. user (User): The user who is deleting the photo. db (AsyncSession): An async session for interacting with the database.

Returns:

bool: True if successful, False otherwise.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Specify the photo to be deleted

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to delete a photo

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

True if the photo was deleted and false if not

async src.repository.photos.edit_photo_description(user: User, photo_id: int, description: str, db: AsyncSession) → dict¶

The edit_photo_description function allows a user to edit the description of an existing photo.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • photo_id – int: Identify the photo to be edited

  • description – str: Pass the description of the photo to be edited

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A photo object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.photos.get_QR_code(path: str, unique_photo_id: <module 'uuid' from '/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.10/lib/python3.10/uuid.py'>, db: ~sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.session.AsyncSession) → str¶
The get_QR_code function takes in a path and unique_photo_id,

creates a QR code from the path, uploads it to cloudinary with the unique photo id as its name. It returns the secure url of that image.

Parameters:

  • path – str: Pass in the path to the image that is being uploaded

  • unique_photo_id – uuid: Make sure that the qr code is unique and not used by another photo

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session

Returns:

A string, but you’re trying to assign it to a photo object

async src.repository.photos.get_all_photos(skip_photos: int, photos_per_page: int, db: AsyncSession) → list[Photo]¶

The get_all_photos function returns a list of Photo objects.

Parameters:

  • skip_photos – int: Skip the first n photos

  • photos_per_page – int: Specify the number of photos to be returned per page

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection

Returns:

A list of photo objects

async src.repository.photos.get_or_create_tag(tag_name: str, db: AsyncSession) → Tag¶

The get_or_create_tag function takes a tag name and an async database session. It then checks if the tag exists in the database, and returns it if so. If not, it creates a new Tag object with that name, adds it to the session, commits the changes to the database (which generates its primary key), refreshes that object from the database (to get its primary key) and returns it.

Parameters:

  • tag_name – str: Specify the name of the tag that we want to create or get

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A tag object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.photos.get_photo_by_id(photo_id: int, db: AsyncSession) → dict | None¶
The get_photo_by_id function returns a photo object from the database.
Args:

photo_id (int): The id of the photo to be returned. db (AsyncSession): An async session for querying the database.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Specify the id of the photo we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the photo’s information

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.repository.photos.init_cloudinary()¶
async src.repository.photos.make_avatar_from_photo(user: User, photo_id: int, effect_mode: str, db: AsyncSession) → Photo¶

The make_avatar_from_photo function takes a photo_id, effect_mode and user as input. It then queries the database for the photo with that id. If it exists, it uploads the image to cloudinary using the given effect mode and returns a url to that image.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the username of the user

  • photo_id – int: Identify the photo that will be used to create an avatar

  • effect_mode – str: Apply a filter to the photo

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: avatar and qr code

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.photos.search_photos(search_keyword: str, photos_per_page: int, skip_photos: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → list[Photo]¶
The search_photos function searches for photos that match the search_keyword.

The function returns a list of Photo objects that match the search_keyword.

Parameters:

  • search_keyword – str: Search for photos that contain the keyword in their description or tags

  • photos_per_page – int: Limit the number of photos per page

  • skip_photos – int: Skip the number of photos specified by this parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a connection to the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in or not

Returns:

A list of photos

async src.repository.photos.search_photos_by_filter(search_keyword: str, rate_min: float, rate_max: float, photos_per_page: int, skip_photos: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → list[Photo]¶
The search_photos_by_filter function searches for photos by a search keyword,

and filters the results with average rating in range from minimum to maximum rating.

Parameters:

  • search_keyword – str: Search for a keyword in the description of the photo

  • rate_min – float: Specify the minimum rating of a photo

  • rate_max – float: Specify the minimum rating of a photo

  • photos_per_page – int: Specify the number of photos to be displayed on one page

  • skip_photos – int: Skip the first n photos

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

Returns:

A list of photo objects

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.change_user_role(user_id: UUID, body: UserUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶
The change_user_role function changes the role of a user.
Args:

user_id (uuid): The id of the user to change. body (UserUpdateSchema): A schema containing information about what to change in the database. db (AsyncSession): An async session for interacting with our database. current_user(User): The currently logged in User object, used for checking permissions and roles.

Parameters:

  • user_id – uuid.UUID: Get the user from the database

  • body – UserUpdateSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is an admin or not

Returns:

A user object with the updated role

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes an email address and a database connection as arguments. It then uses the get_user_by_email function to retrieve the user with that email address from the database. It sets the confirmed field of that user to True, and commits those changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to confirm

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

A user object, which is a sqlalchemy model

  • password – str: Set the new password for the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

None

REST API routes Photos¶

async src.routes.photos.add_tag(photo_id: int, tag: str, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The add_tag function adds a tag to the photo with the given id.

If there is no such tag, it will be created. If there is already such a tag under this photo, an error message will be displayed.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Identify the photo to which we want to add a tag

  • tag – str: Specify the tag that will be added to the photo

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A tag, which is added to the photo

async src.routes.photos.change_photo(photo_id: int, width: int | None, height: int | None, crop_mode: CropMode = Form(None), effect: Effect = Form(None), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The change_photo function changes the photo.

round, high, width, face, cartoonify, vignette, borders Можна одразу повертати json з лінком та QR-кодом на світлину - так і треба

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Identify the photo to be changed

  • width – int | None: Set the width of the image

  • height – int | None: Set the height of the photo

  • crop_mode – CropMode: Specify the cropping mode: fill, thumb, fit, limit, pad or scale

  • description – Describe the parameter in the documentation

  • thumb – Crop the image to a square

  • fit – Fit the image to a certain size

  • limit – Limit the number of photos returned in a single request

  • pad – Add padding to the image

  • scale – Scale the image

  • effect – Effect: Apply the effect to the photo

  • description – Describe the endpoint

  • user – User: Get the user who is making the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A dictionary with the following keys: ‘transformed_url’, ‘QR code’

Doc-author:

Trelent

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

deleting was successful and if it wasn’t, why it failed.

async src.routes.photos.edit_photo_record(photo_id: int, new_description: str, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The edit_photo_record function allows a user to edit the description of an existing photo.

It also allows them to add tags to the photo.

  • new_description – str: Pass the new description of the photo

  • user – User: Get the user who is making the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

The updated_photo object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.photos.get_all_photos(skip_photos: int = 0, photos_per_page: int = 10, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_all_photos function returns a list of all photos in the database.

The function takes three arguments: skip_photos, photos_per_page and user. The skip_photos argument is an integer that specifies how many photos to skip before returning results. The default value for this argument is 0, which means no skipping will occur and the first photo will be returned.

The photos_per_page argument is an integer that specifies how many results to return per page (i.e., per request). The default value for this argument is 10, which means 10 results will be

Parameters:

  • skip_photos – int: Skip the first n photos

  • photos_per_page – int: Specify how many photos will be displayed on one page

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database connection

Returns:

A list of photos

async src.routes.photos.get_photo(photo_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_photo function is used to get a photo by its id.

The function returns the photo with all of its data (description, comments, link and QR-code).

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo by its id

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A photo with a description, comments, link and qr code

async src.routes.photos.make_avatar(photo_id: int, effect_mode: EffectMode = Form(None), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The make_avatar function is used to create a QR code from the photo_id.

The effect_mode parameter can be used to specify how the image should be cropped. If no effect mode is specified, then it will default to None.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo_id from the request

  • effect_mode – EffectMode: Set the cropping mode of the avatar

  • description – Document the api

  • thumb – Crop the image in a square shape

  • fit – Crop the image to a certain size

  • limit – Limit the number of photos returned

  • pad – Add padding to the image

  • scale – Resi the image

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A url

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.photos.put_photo(photo_description: str | None = Form(None), file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), tags: list[str] = Form(None), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The put_photo function is used to add a photo.

201 or error

Parameters:

  • photo_description – str | None: Describe the photo

  • description – Add a description to the photo

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • tags – list[str]: Get a list of tags from the request separated by ‘,’

  • description – Add a description to the photo

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository function

Returns:

A new_photo object

async src.routes.photos.search_photo(photos_per_page: int = Query(10), skip_photos: int = Query(0), search_keyword: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), rate_min: float = Query(None), rate_max: float = Query(None), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The search_photo function searches for photos in the database.

The search_photo function takes in a keyword, and returns all photos that contain the keyword. If no photo is found with the specified parameters, an HTTP 204 No Content error is raised.

Parameters:

  • photos_per_page – int: Specify how many photos should be returned per page

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of a parameter

  • le – Specify the maximum value of a parameter

  • skip_photos – int: Skip the first n photos in the database

  • search_keyword – str: Search for photos with the specified keyword

  • rate_min – float: Specify the minimum rating of a photo

  • rate_max – float: Filter photos by the maximum rating

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of photos

REST API routes Comments¶

Comments API Routes Provides API routes for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting comments.

async src.routes.comments.create_comment(photo_id: int, comment: CommentSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function creates a comment for the photo with photo_id.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo_id from the url

  • comment – CommentSchema: Get the comment from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user’s id

Returns:

A CommentResposeSchema object containing the created comment.

async src.routes.comments.delete_comment(comment_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Function deletes a comment with comment_id from the database.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Get the comment_id from the url

  • user – User: Get the current user’s id

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A CommentResposeSchema object containing the deleted comment.

async src.routes.comments.get_all_comments(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), photo_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Function returns a list of comments for the photo with photo_id

Limit:

int: Get the limit from the query parameters

Offset:

int: Get the offset from the query parameters

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo_id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of comments for the photo with photo_id. If the photo with photo_id is not found, an HTTPException is raised.

async src.routes.comments.get_user_comments(photo_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), user_id: UUID | None = None, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function returns a list of users comments with user_id for the photo with photo_id If user not specified, function returns a list of comments for the current user for the photo with photo_id.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user_id – int: Get the comments of a specific user

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo_id from the url

  • user – User: Get the current user’s id

Returns:

A list of comments

async src.routes.comments.update_comment(comment_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), body: CommentUpdateSchema = Body(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function updates a comment with comment_id in the database.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Get the comment_id from the url

  • body – CommentUpdateSchema: Get the comment from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user’s id

Returns:

A CommentUpdateSchema object containing the updated comment.

REST API routes Ratings¶

Rating API Routes Provides API routes for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting rating

async src.routes.ratings.create_rating(photo_id: int, rate: int = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function creates a rating for a photo with photo_id. If photo with photo_id does not exist, function raises HTTPException. If user already set rating for photo, function raises HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: The id of the photo to rate.

  • rate – int: The rating value.

  • db – AsyncSession: The database session.

  • user – User: The current user.

Returns:

A RatingResponseSchema object containing the created rating.

Raises:

  • HTTPException – If photo with photo_id does not exist, or if user already set rating for photo.

  • HTTPException – If rate is not between 1 and 5.

  • HTTPException – If user is not authenticated.

  • HTTPException – If user is not authorized to access the operation.

async src.routes.ratings.delete_rating(rating_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Function deletes a rating with rating_id from the database. If rating with rating_id does not exist, function raises HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • rating_id – int: Get the rating_id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A RatingResponseSchema object containing the deleted rating.

Raises:

HTTPException – If rating with rating_id does not exist.

async src.routes.ratings.get_avg_rating(photo_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Function returns the average rating for a photo with photo_id. If photo with photo_id does not exist, function raises HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo_id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A RatingAVGResponseSchema object containing the average rating.

Raises:

HTTPException – If photo with photo_id does not exist.

async src.routes.ratings.get_user_rating(photo_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), user_id: UUID | None = None, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function returns a user rating for a photo with photo_id. If user not specified, function returns a user rating for the current user for the photo with photo_id. If user rating does not exist, function raises HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo_id from the url

  • user_id – uuid.UUID: Get the user_id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user’s id

Returns:

A RatingResponseSchema object containing the user rating.

Raises:

  • HTTPException – If photo with photo_id does not exist.

  • HTTPException – If user rating does not exist.

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.change_user_role(body: UserChangeRole, user_id: UUID = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The change_user_role function changes the role of a user.

The function takes in a UserChangeRole object, which contains the new role for the user. It also takes in an optional path parameter, which is used to identify the user whose role will be changed. If no path parameter is provided, then it defaults to None and raises an HTTPException with status code 404 (Not Found).

Args:

body (UserChangeRole): A UserChangeRole object containing information about what new role should be assigned to a given user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserChangeRole: Get the role from the request body

  • user_id – uuid.UUID: Get the user id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • user – User: Check if the user making the request is an admin

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.delete_user(id: UUID = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_user function deletes a user from the database.

The function takes in an id as a path parameter and returns a message indicating that the user has been deleted. If no user is found with the given id, then it will return an HTTP 404 error code with detail message of &quot;User not found&quot;.

Parameters:

  • id – uuid.UUID: Get the user id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the token

Returns:

A dict with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.get_all_users(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_all_users function returns a list of all users in the database.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of users returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Set the maximum value of the limit parameter

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

The get_me function returns the current user’s information.
get:

summary: Get the current user’s information. description: Returns a UserResponse object containing all of the current user’s info, including their username and email address. This endpoint is protected by JWT authentication, so you must provide a valid token in order to access it.

Parameters:

user – User: Specify the type of data that will be returned

Returns:

The current user

username (str): The username of the user whose info is being requested. db (AsyncSession): An async session for interacting with a database. Defaults to Depends(get_db). user (User): A User object representing the current logged in user, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository function

uploads the file to cloudinary, updates the avatar_url in the database and returns a UserResponse object.

User: A User object representing an updated version of the original

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their email address. Then, it checks if there is a user with that email in the database. If not, then an error message will be returned. If there is a user with that email, then we check if they have already confirmed their account or not by checking whether or not they are confirmed (True/False). If they are already confirmed, then we return another message saying so; otherwise we update them as being confirmed and

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_reset_passw(body: UserResetPassword, token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_reset_passw function is used to reset a user’s password.
It takes in the following parameters:

body: UserResetPassword - The new password for the user. token: str - The verification token sent to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – UserResetPassword: Get the password from the user

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user. It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful. The access token can be used to make requests on behalf of that user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token and the type of token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.logout(token: str, user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The logout function is used to logout a user.

It takes in the token of the user and returns a message that says &quot;Successfully logged out.&quot;

Parameters:

  • token – Annotated[str: Pass the token to the logout function

  • Depends(auth_service.oauth2_scheme)] – Get the token from the request header

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The message &quot;logout successful&quot; as a json object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.recieve_conf_reset_passw()¶

The recieve_conf_reset_passw function is used to recieve confirmation for update password. It returns a JSON object with the message &quot;We recieved confirmation for update password&quot;.

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. The function takes in a refresh_token and returns an access_token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session

Returns:

An access_token and a refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. The function then checks if the user exists and if they have already confirmed their account. If they have not, the function sends an email containing a link that will allow them to confirm their account.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message that the user can check their email for confirmation

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_passw_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_passw_email function is used to send an email with a link to reset the password. The user must enter his email and if it exists, he will receive an email with a link that will take him to the page where he can update his password.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Run the function asynchronously

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database. It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account with that email already exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • data – dict: Store the data that is to be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the time for which the token is valid

Returns:

A string of the encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶
The create_email_token function creates a token that is used to verify the user’s email address.
The token contains the following information:

  • iat (issued at): The time when the token was created.

  • exp (expiration): The time when this token will expire and no longer be valid. This is set to 1 day from creation by default, but can be changed in config.py if desired.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method a bound method, which means that the first parameter will always be

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded into a token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the data passed to it

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user. The function takes in two parameters: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary containing the user’s id, username, email address, and password hash. Expires_delta is an optional parameter that determines how long the refresh token will be valid for.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiry time of the refresh token

Returns:

A jwt token with the following claims:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail ‘Invalid scope for token’ or ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be called by FastAPI to retrieve the current user for each request. It uses the OAuth2PasswordBearer to validate and decode the JWT token in the Authorization header of each request.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first tries to decode the token using jwt.decode, which will raise a JWTError if it fails to decode the token. If decoding is successful, then we return the email address from within the payload of our decoded JSON Web Token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address of the user who is requesting a password reset

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a recipient for the message. -username: this is used in the body of the message, and will be displayed in the letter in email-template.html. -host: this is where your website lives (e.g., &quot;localhost&quot; or &quot;127.0.0.1&quot;

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine object that we can await

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.email.send_reset_passw_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_reset_passw_email function sends an email to the user with a link to reset their password.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. username (str): The username of the account that is requesting a password reset.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Check if the email is valid

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who requested a password reset

  • host – str: Create the reset password link

Returns:

object that we can await

Doc-author:

Trelent
